column2: This new iteration of the former Santa Monica museum is superb.
column3: Recently re-located to an unexpected spot near Skid Row, the ICA is pointed in their explanation about shifting their focus to being much more concerned with social activism, and the new location reflects that intentionally. When I was there an excellent recreation of a Harald Szeeman exhibition from the 1970â€™s was installed, it was eye-opening. The Marfa Book Company had a pop-up bookshop in the space alongside a beautiful installation of clothes and objects from Dhosa. The ICA felt like a breath of fresh air, pure & sincere.
